div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 12, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. June 12 99
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
Your letter came this
morning, and we were glad to learn
that you had arrived safely. Your paper
came on Friday. We will take the rooms
at Mrs Taylor's cottage. I find that the
Colonial Express does not run on Sunday.
As Monday would not be a convenient
day for starting. Mabel will probably
go on Tuesday and reach Hatley
Wednesday morning. The cool wave
reached us Friday evening. Buster
seems none the worse for the hot
spell. He gained nearly half a pound
during the week. Thank you for the informa-
tion about golf etc. I shall write a
longer letter in a day or two. Mabel
sends love.
